_header: An hot winter a tempestly summer
_description: Prognostications for the coming year based on the Dominical Letter — nineteen couplets

HunHM64.First Lines:
A An hoote wynter A tempestly somerPlenty of corne of frute goode
                    caster…
HunHM64.Last Lines:
…G An hoote wynter a tempestly somerA temparat haruyste &
                    tempest of fyereA ffevorus yere litill hony & goode flax
                    yereDyinge of olde folkis moche haye in feere
HunHM64.Note:
In order of Dominical Letters, BAGFEDC, so out of order in relation to
                    alphabet; Dominical letters precede each stanza; interspersed with 3122.
HunHM64.Editions:
Mooney,  Linne R. 
             “Practical Didactic Works in Middle English.” 
         Diss. Toronto, 1981: 353-6.
